newsitem.title: UK: London freight market starts week quietly.
newsitem.headline: London freight market starts week quietly.

text.p: The freight market started the week quietly, due to a holiday in Japan on Monday and with many brokers having just returned from an annual trade event in Hamburg.
However, owners of modern Panamaxes remained confident about market prospects in most areas, except South America.
Brokers said Capers were still in short supply in the Pacific and rates have edged forward in the transatlantic trades. The BFI rose 10 points today to 1,333.
GRAIN - U.S. Gulf/Egypt was covered by Cargill on private terms and there were reports that Romac fixed Regina for about 84,000 tonnes Mississippi to Egypt for mid-Nov at a lumpsum of $1.1 million.
The 1977-built Pamphilos 64,100 tonnes dwt was said to have been fixed delivery prompt Gibraltar for a transatlantic round at $9,000 daily, possibly also with grain to the east Med.
Transfield booked a couple of New York-controlled Panamaxes for 50,000 tonnes HSS U.S. Gulf/cHina for Nov 6/16 and 15/25 at a firmer $25.50, probably with the usual option to add fertilizer.

New orders today included Progress 60/80,000 tonnes dwt delivery South Brazil up to Nov 20 for two to four months, Shipmair 50/70,000 tonnes dwt delivery Recalada end-Nov trip Continent, and Harvest States 50,000 tonnes corn U.S. Gulf/Aqaba for Dec 10/20.
In the handy category Glencore were said to have booked 21,000 tonnes wheat Rouen/Morocco for prompt loading at close to $13.00.
Fresh business included Andre with 27,500 tonnes products 58' up river/Malaysia for Nov 13/20 and Toepfer 18,000 tonnes HSS Immingham/Italy for Nov 15.
In the east it was rumoured that Atlantic Statesman 65,015 tonnes dwt was fixed on subjects for grain from Nopac to Bin Qasim.
MINERALS - Brokers pointed out that cobelfret fixed at a firmer level of $5.95 for 110,000 tonnes coal Baltimore/Rotterdam with New Luck for Dec 1/10.

Mosk agreed between $9,000 and $9,250 daily for Excelsior 122,829 tonnes dwt delivery Continent mid-Nov for a Richards Bay coal round, and La Loma 112,905 tonnes dwt was believed taken delivery Dunkirk about Nov 10 for two transatlantic rounds at a little over $8,000 daily.

Cape Cathay 149,433 tonnes dwt was reported fixed and failed for coal from Banjermasin to Rotterdam. Tatry was linked with a 65,000 tonne coal stem from Banjermasin to El Ferrol and Samsun with Lia 69,447 tonnes dwt from Richards Bay to Morocco but full details were lacking.
Atlantic Statesman 65,015 tonnes dwt was rumoured to be on subjects for ironore from India to the Far East.
Pan ocean fixed Menalon 66,464 tonnes dwt for trans-Pacific business, possibly at $8,200 daily, and Minea 61,000 tonnes dwt was believed to be on subjects for a Nopac round.

Daiichi were linked with Irrawaddy 70,000 tonnes dwt for an Australian coal round. In the Atlantic Ipanema 75,203 tonnes dwt and Delphic Pride 64,500 tonnes dwt were understood fixed on private terms.
HANDIES - With the exception of the U.S. Gulf conditions were generally flat.

Van Ommeren fixed Bauta 41,756 tonnes dwt delivery prompt Continent trip Turkey at $9,450 daily and Pan Ocean took Emerald 46,054 tonnes dwt delivery Continent Nov 20/25 trip Far East at an unremarkable $11,550 daily.
Due to the Japanese bank holiday little was heard of fixing activity in the Far East.
--London Newsroom, +44 171 542 8080
